## Bootstrap 5.3 Creating Modal Forms ### Introduction Modal forms are a common UI component used in web applications to display forms in a popup window. Bootstrap is a popular front-end framework that provides a set of CSS and JavaScript components for building responsive and mobile-first websites. In this tutorial, we will learn how to create modal forms using Bootstrap 5.3. ### Objective and Scope The objective of this tutorial is to demonstrate how to use Bootstrap 5.3 to create modal forms in your web applications. The scope of this tutorial includes the step-by-step instructions for creating a basic modal form and customizing its appearance and functionality. ### Requirements and Pre-requisites To follow along with this tutorial, you will need the following: - Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript - A code editor (e.g., Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text) - Bootstrap 5.3 CSS and JavaScript files (can be downloaded from the official Bootstrap website or included via CDN) ### Step-by-Step Instructions 1.
